projects.title: Microservices E-Commerce Platform
projects.description: Build a scalable e-commerce backend using microservices architecture with separate services for products, orders, users, and payments
projects.shortDescription: Microservices platform with REST APIs, message queues, and distributed architecture
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-grade microservices-based e-commerce platform demonstrating service decomposition, inter-service communication, API gateway patterns, and event-driven architecture. This project showcases your ability to design distributed systems, implement REST/gRPC APIs, handle asynchronous messaging, and manage data consistency across services.

implementationSteps.title: Design Service Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Decompose the system into microservices: User Service (authentication, profiles), Product Service (catalog, inventory), Order Service (cart, checkout), Payment Service (transactions). Define service boundaries using domain-driven design. Create API contracts and database schemas for each service ensuring loose coupling.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Core Services with REST APIs
implementationSteps.description: Build each microservice using Node.js/Django/Spring Boot with its own database (MongoDB/PostgreSQL). Implement RESTful APIs with proper HTTP methods, status codes, and error handling. Add JWT-based authentication in User Service. Ensure each service can run independently with Docker containers.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up API Gateway & Service Communication
implementationSteps.description: Implement an API Gateway (Kong/Express Gateway) as a single entry point for all client requests. Configure routing, authentication, and rate limiting at the gateway. Implement synchronous communication between services using REST/gRPC for real-time requests. Add service discovery if using multiple instances.

implementationSteps.title: Add Event-Driven Communication
implementationSteps.description: Set up RabbitMQ or Kafka for asynchronous messaging between services. Implement event publishing: when an order is placed, publish 'OrderCreated' event. Implement event consumers: Payment Service listens for 'OrderCreated', Product Service updates inventory. Handle idempotency and message acknowledgments for reliability.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy with Docker Compose & Add Monitoring
implementationSteps.description: Create Dockerfiles for each service and a docker-compose.yml for orchestration. Set up environment variables and service dependencies. Add health check endpoints for each service. Implement logging with ELK stack or use cloud logging. Add API documentation with Swagger. Deploy to cloud (AWS/Azure/GCP) or keep local with comprehensive README.

projects.title: High-Performance API Gateway with Rate Limiting
projects.description: Build a production-ready API gateway with rate limiting, caching, authentication, and load balancing for backend microservices
projects.shortDescription: API Gateway with rate limiting, caching, and authentication middleware
projects.fullDescription: Create a robust API gateway that serves as the entry point for multiple backend services. Implement advanced features including token-based authentication, Redis-based rate limiting, response caching, request/response transformation, and load balancing. This project demonstrates your understanding of API design patterns, performance optimization, security best practices, and distributed system concepts.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Gateway Server & Routing
implementationSteps.description: Initialize a Node.js/Express or Python/Flask project as the API gateway. Define routing configuration to map incoming requests to backend services (e.g., /api/users → User Service, /api/products → Product Service). Implement reverse proxy functionality using http-proxy-middleware or similar. Add request/response logging middleware for observability.

implementationSteps.title: Implement JWT Authentication Middleware
implementationSteps.description: Create authentication middleware that validates JWT tokens in request headers. Implement token generation endpoint for login. Add role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict certain routes. Handle token expiration and refresh token logic. Secure sensitive routes and allow public routes to bypass authentication.

implementationSteps.title: Build Redis-Based Rate Limiting
implementationSteps.description: Set up Redis for distributed rate limiting across gateway instances. Implement token bucket or sliding window algorithm for rate limiting. Configure different rate limits per user tier (free: 100 req/hour, premium: 1000 req/hour). Return proper HTTP 429 status with retry-after headers when limit exceeded. Add rate limit headers to responses showing remaining quota.

implementationSteps.title: Add Response Caching Layer
implementationSteps.description: Implement Redis-based caching for GET requests to improve performance. Set TTL (time-to-live) for cached responses based on endpoint. Add cache-control headers and implement cache invalidation strategies. Create cache warming for frequently accessed data. Monitor cache hit/miss ratios for optimization.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Load Balancing & Monitoring
implementationSteps.description: Add round-robin or least-connections load balancing for backend service instances. Implement health check endpoints to detect unhealthy services. Add circuit breaker pattern to prevent cascading failures. Set up monitoring with Prometheus metrics (request count, latency, error rate). Create comprehensive API documentation with Swagger. Dockerize and deploy with docker-compose.

projects.title: Distributed Real-Time Notification System
projects.description: Build a scalable real-time notification system using WebSockets, message queues, and distributed architecture with multiple delivery channels
projects.shortDescription: Real-time notification system with WebSockets, Kafka, and multi-channel delivery
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-grade distributed notification system that handles real-time notifications at scale. Implement WebSocket connections for live updates, Kafka for reliable message delivery, Redis for presence tracking, and support multiple delivery channels (email, SMS, push, in-app). This advanced project demonstrates distributed systems design, real-time communication, event-driven architecture, and scalability patterns essential for mid-level backend engineers.

implementationSteps.title: Design System Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Design a distributed architecture with: API Service (REST endpoints for creating notifications), WebSocket Service (maintains client connections), Notification Worker (processes notifications from Kafka), Delivery Service (handles email/SMS/push). Define notification schema with: id, userId, type, priority, channels, payload. Plan for horizontal scaling with multiple instances behind load balancer.

implementationSteps.title: Implement WebSocket Server & Connection Management
implementationSteps.description: Build WebSocket server using Socket.io/ws library with authentication via JWT tokens. Implement connection pooling and user presence tracking in Redis. Handle reconnection logic with exponential backoff. Create room-based broadcasting for user-specific notifications. Add heartbeat/ping-pong for connection health monitoring. Support horizontal scaling with Redis adapter for multi-instance WebSocket servers.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Kafka Producer & Consumer
implementationSteps.description: Configure Kafka cluster with topics for different notification types (high-priority, low-priority). Implement Kafka producer in API Service to publish notification events. Build consumer workers that subscribe to Kafka topics and process notifications. Handle message acknowledgment, dead letter queues for failed notifications, and exactly-once delivery semantics. Add retry logic with exponential backoff.

implementationSteps.title: Build Multi-Channel Delivery System
implementationSteps.description: Implement delivery adapters for each channel: EmailAdapter (SendGrid/AWS SES), SMSAdapter (Twilio), PushAdapter (Firebase Cloud Messaging), InAppAdapter (WebSocket). Create notification template system with variable substitution. Implement delivery preferences (user can opt-out of channels). Add delivery status tracking (sent, delivered, failed, read). Store notification history in PostgreSQL/MongoDB.

implementationSteps.title: Add Rate Limiting, Monitoring & Testing
implementationSteps.description: Implement rate limiting per user and per channel to prevent spam. Add notification batching for efficiency (combine multiple notifications). Create admin dashboard to view notification metrics and statistics. Set up monitoring with Prometheus/Grafana for delivery rates, latency, error rates. Implement integration tests for each delivery channel. Add load testing to validate system handles 10k+ concurrent WebSocket connections. Document API with Swagger and deployment with Kubernetes manifests.
